p: In our study, the RO EO was able to inhibit the growth of C. albicans in a similar concentration as PD ( Table 1). A few studies reported the activity of RO EO against this yeast with discrepancies. For example, although in our study a MIC of 0.6 mg/mL was measured, higher MICs ranging between 5 mg/mL and ~10 mg/mL (1%) were measured in other reports [ 38, 39]. Also, a very low MIC of 5.6 μL/mL was measured in a different study [ 40], but it is noteworthy that this low MIC was expressed as MIC 80 and not MIC 100 as in our study. Again, different chemotype oils may be the cause of the large difference in the MICs. Another study reported antifungal activity of RO EO against F. verticillioides with a calculated MIC of 150 μg/mL [ 41]. Again, our results are not comparable to this study because the strain used was not in our screening panel of fungi.
